alert.note: Alert for Linn (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 04 at 5:47PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Oregon, including the following county, Linn. * WHEN...Until 645 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 545 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... rural areas of east central Linn County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
